bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>Feature description</denchmark-h>
It would be lovely to have the files included in official distribution, so that other packages can confidently build against . I'm looking to make a <denchmark-link:https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/issues/10517>conda package for neuralcoref</denchmark-link> , and my approach of merging the pypi tarball (preferred) and the github tarball (which has the pxd, but probably isn't tested) gives me the willies . <denchmark-h:h2>Could the feature be a custom component or spaCy plugin?</denchmark-h>
Pretty much would have to be on the mainline. Luckily, I'd imagine it's a one-liner to MANIFEST.in, but I don't know enough about the build chain to know if that's A Bad Idea for some reason... other than size, perhaps? If there's no obvious red flags, I'll PR said line!

comments.comment: Hey, We definitely intend the pxd to be in the source tarball! The cython api is part of the api, and it's intended to be usable by downstream packages. This is a bug in recent releases after updating our setup logic. We'll get that fixed. We're also working actively to get neuralcoref into the main library :). If you have time to work on this it's possible we could use your help? I'm travelling today but hopefully I can write more tonight.

Intriguing! I'm more of an amateur packaging puzzle solver than professional cython hacker (or even spacy power user), but I do have it all building locally, so at least there's that.
So, always glad to help! Sure sounds easier than maintaining _n_ additional packages in the long run, as I thought would be required. Getting the pretrained model pip-installable would help heaps, too.
In the near term, if the pxd are coming back, I won't worry about how ugly my hack is to get something out. <denchmark-link:#>…</denchmark-link>
